It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically greenish-yellow in color and has a distinctive triangular leaf-like structure. The plant grows on bark and rock surfaces in temperate regions, often in shaded, humid environments. It is known for its chemical composition, which includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of environmental conditions.
